titleStmt.title: William M. Wiley to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2253

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Indianapolis Ind
Oct 20" 65
To his Excellency
The Governor of Kentucky
Frankfort
Dr Sir

My commission as Commissioner of Deeds for Kentucky having nearly expired. I would respectfully request that the new commission issue to Luther R Martin of this City as other engagements will prevent my further continuance in the office.

Indianapolis Ind
Oct 20" 1865
To his Excellency
the Governor of Kentucky
Dr Sir
I am acquainted with Luther R Martin of this city & believe him to be a competent person to discharge the duties of Commissioner of Deeds for your state

Respectfully
O. P. Morton
Gov. of Ind'a

Comr Deeds
Indiana
Luther R. Martin
comd
23d Oct 1865
